title: Meopham Walks

images.title: Robin Webster / Meopham Green
images.caption: Meopham Green and windmill view. A picturesque triangular green with views all round, not just in this direction. The windmill was built in 1801. It was restored in 2005 by the council and is now open to the public for part of the year.

images.title: Valley View near Meopham by Roger Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Valley View near Meopham

images.title: Camer Country Park by Robin Webster, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Camer Country Park

images.title: Danny Robinson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath Junction Near Luddesdown. Where the Wealdway turns right and goes down hill.

images.title: Stephen Craven / Church of St Peter & St Paul, Luddesdown
images.caption: Church of St Peter & St Paul, Luddesdown. Grade II* listed Anglican church, with 13th century origins but largely rebuilt in the 19th century.

images.title: Lisa Fulcher / Luddesdown Court and church
images.caption: Luddesdown Court and church

description: This Kent based village has a number of local woods and parks to visit. The village itself includes a picturesque village green with a cricket pitch and restored windmill. The wonderful scenery of the North Downs is also nearby opening up many walking possibilities. This walk from the village takes you east to Camer Park and the neighbouring village of Luddesdown. You can follow public footpaths east from the village, past Meopham Court to the country park. There's a number of trails here to follow around the park's 40 acres of ancient parkland, grassland and woods. You can also pick up the long distance Wealdway here and follow it to the nearby village of Luddesdown. The pretty village includes some interesting buildings such as Luddesdown Court and a 13th century Grade II listed church.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The King's Arms at Meopham Green is a good choice for some post walk refreshments. Inside there's a cosy interior with original beams and wood burners. They also have a nice garden area for warmer weather. You can find them on Wrotham Road overlooking the green at postcode DA13 0PZ for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south along the Wealdway and you could visit Trosley Country Park. Near Luddesdown you can pick up the North Downs Way and follow it east to visit Rochester with its river trails and old castle. The attractive village of Upnor with its English Heritage owned 16th century castle is also worth seeing in this area. To the north there's good cycling and walking trails around Shorne Woods Country Park and Cobham Park where there's an old deer park and a Roman Villa to see. For more walking ideas in the area see the Kent Walks and the North Downs Walks pages.

display_address: The Street, Meopham, Gravesham, Kent, England, DA13 0AJ, United Kingdom
